intro: Geissorhiza karooica, commonly known as the Karoo lily, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features a short, sturdy stem with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are typically blue to purple in color and are borne in clusters at the top of the stem. Geissorhiza karooica thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
